title: Problem 2118_B
statement: There is a matrix A of size n× n where A_{i,j}=j for all 1 ≤ i,j ≤ n. In one operation, you can select a row and reverse any subarray^{\text{∗}} in it. Find a sequence of at most 2n operations such that every column will contain a permutation^{\text{†}} of length n.It can be proven that the construction is always possible. If there are multiple solutions, output any of them.^{\text{∗}}An array a is a subarray of an array b if a can be obtained from b by deleting zero or more elements from the be
